I install the drive (used parts and below specs again), turn the laptop on and... What's that horrible whining sound?! Conclusion: Yet another failed disk. And to be sure of my diagnostic, I extract an old drive from an old laptop. I successfully reinstall my Lenovo laptop and the old drive.Request #3: Calling Lenovo again. They want me to return the laptop. I make sure they understand the nature of the problem, why returning the laptop makes little sense and why I expect a drive with, at least, the same specifications as the one I originally bought. A week later, the promised drive wasn't there yet (and actually never arrived).Request #4: On the phone with Lenovo... They don't know what happened to the previous drive. They'll send a new one, with the right specifications. I didn't bother opening the drive when I received it, it wasn't the right kind!!! In the meantime, tired of waiting, I had bought a new drive at a local store. Unsurprisingly, it did wonder in my laptop.Request #5: Moving online to avoid being impolite on the phone. There, I go through a weird registration and realized all the limit of their support tools. I almost feel sad for the support people working there. I try my best to describe all the extent of my issues with Lenovo. The field limit to 150 characters don't help, at all. My request: A real solution, in the form of a real drive or a real check to cover the purchase of a new real drive. And, a couple of days later, I receive... an empty box?? After some head-scratching, I understand they want me to return my laptop... #FacePalm!!! It's time to share my story with the Amazonians.Request #6: I'll get to that as soon as I'm done posting this story. I'll update the post if anything interesting happens.If you ever buy the laptop you're looking at, I wish you good luck!------------------------------------[Update: 07/09/2013, Lenovo sent another empty box :-((( I'm done with them! This is absolutely hopeless!]

Reviews.Title: Decent computer for a decent price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First off, I purchased this item on Newegg for $599. Just wanted to share my review on the laptop here so more people can be informed.Pros: - Responsive Touch Screen- Decent speed- Lightweight- Great Size- Bright/Colorful Screen- Good Wireless- Quick Charge (see cons) *- 2x USB 3.0 ports- Price (got a $100 off coupon, thanks Newegg!)- Great Swivel- Decent Sound- Decent size HDD (see other thoughts) **- Gorilla Glass (see cons) ***- Spill Resistant KeyboardCons: - Battery doesn't last long (about 4.5 hours on use) *- Lots of Bloatware- Glossy Screen ***- Windows 8 Installation disc not included (but it is installed, easy to make restore cd's)- No backlit keyboardOther Thoughts: - The first thing that needs to be done is to update all the drivers. The laptop can be a bit finicky at first, but all was well after they were updated.- There was a lot of Bloatware (Lenovo Software) when I first booted it up. None of it is really all that essential, so I uninstalled most of it.- It works well (most of the time) with Windows 8. I had to deactivate the keyboard TrackPoint (red looking button in the middle of the keyboard) because when it was in Tablet mode, the stick would cause the mouse pointer on the screen to move. Not a big issue though.- ** I am unsure whether or not this actually has a 24GB SSD. Normally, the OS is installed onto it. The problem with this is that it would leave virtually no space for caching or programs. I would think more than likely that the 24GB is saved for the caching itself. However, the SSD doesn't show up under the drive listing. Plus, why not just add more RAM for caching instead? Something to look into...- Overall it runs fast, cool, and without hiccups. Glad we purchased it and my wife loves it so far (minus the non backlit keyboard).

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: It's more than I expected!  I absolutely love it.  I've only had it for a couple of weeks but I have really enjoyed it.  I had no trouble downloading Quicken 2013 or the MS Office 2003 software that I have.  The first Netflix video I pulled up surprised me because the picture was fantastic!  I only have 2 concerns at the moment: 1.) I can't seem to get an ebook reader.  I loved "10,000+ Ebook Reader" for Android on my original tablet but I can't find a similar program for Windows 8,  2.) I'm a little worried how the connection, between the monitor and the keyboard, will stand up to the test of time.  I do change from the laptop position to the tablet position a lot.  At this moment, I would recommend this Ultrabook to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Better han advertised
Reviews.Author: Jose big sound
Reviews.Content: I am a technology enthusiast. I enjoy and demand a fast computer. This little guy is fun to work with because it's fast and light weight to carry around. I have been working with Windows 8 with my mouse and keyboard on my PC at home, Once I started taking advantage of the touch feature and the writing capabilities for taking notes. I was in heaven.

Reviews.Title: So far really good
Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: Battery life is only "ok" but everything else has been good. A laptop that quickly and easily transforms into a tablet.

Reviews.Title: dual external monitor possible
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: It has both micro-hdmi and mini-displayport. So It is possible to connect two external monitor to this machine.I used a micro-hdmi to hdmi cable. And I used a mini dp to DVI adapter + DVI cable.Two enable both external monitor, you will have to connect one monitor first. Let the the monitor to mirror the laptop screen.Now connect the second monitor and choose extend desktop.Finally, try to disable the laptop screen.There is no way that you use two external monitor + laptop screen. (Though Intel's website states the possibility) I assume that Lenovo might have assigned very little system memory for the HD4000 video card. And there is no place in BIOS that you can increase that.I am typing using two 24 inch monitor at 1920x1080. Can't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Loved the design, but ultimately returned it.
Reviews.Author: Rick "reb_el"
Reviews.Content: I loved the physical design of this device, how it could switch from a laptop to a tablet, giving me the best of both worlds.  Unfortunately, it kept disconnecting from my WIFI, saying the signal was weak, even though it was inches from my router and none of my other devices had trouble connecting to it.  I talked to some people and they tell me it's a common problem with Windows 8, so it may not have been the machines fault.  Perhaps in a year or so when Windows 8 has all its beta bugs removed, this might be a great device. If so, I will then highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: Maresa M.
Reviews.Content: After some problems with the windows 8 system, I really fell in love with this ultrabook.It's really light , so that you can actually use it like a tablet and with the keyboard it's perfect for typing longer documents, too.Because I wasn't used to working with Windows 8 it took me a while to figure everything out, but now I like it.Sometimes it has trouble with changing from the tablet to the laptop position and it takes some time to rotate in the right position, but after changing a few settings everything is working how i wanted it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: brian speicher
Reviews.Content: its compact,light, easily converts to a pad, and easy to take around.  I really like windows 8, but there is a learning curve, not a steep one though.  Battery life is probably the biggest negative

Reviews.Title: None better
Reviews.Author: Aritakum "Sm"
Reviews.Content: I have had the Lenovo ThinkPad Twist S230u 12.5-Inch Touchscreen Ultrabook (Black) for about 4 weeks now. Without getting too technical, I can say there is nothing in this category out there that has what this Twist has!This is what I wanted in my ultrabook:Touch screen -windows 8At least 4GB memAt least 500Gb HD with SSDUnder 3.8 lbs.I tried the Viao, Asus, HP spectre and finally settled for u230. The others were either too heavy, had bad touch screen or had wireless dropping issues.This twist sure is not as pretty looking like the others, in fact the black finish that attracts hand prints is downright disgusting (but can be fixed-clean wipe)Battery is not great, but like others who have suggested software upgrades (BIOS as well) its now up to 51/2-41/2 hrs ..not too shabbyNo other ultrabook comes close to the specs I listed and as a bonus this one has a twist (with non-exposed keyboard (Yoga))I recommend this strongly

Reviews.Content: Only problem I have with the Twist is the wireless connection it sucks. No problems with anything else but the wireless connection. Reviews.Title: Love the new technology

Reviews.Content: The transition to this from my old simple PC was a bit frustrating but overall this is a great product and I would recommend it. The more I use it, the more I like it. The touchscreen feature is great (except for the need to constantly remove fingerprints). I love the it is very light and fits into a bag easily for traveling. Good battery life.

Reviews.Author: Edgar Perez "Ed"
Reviews.Content: I have been working with this machine for 3 weeks now, and I have found the following glitches that make it really annoying to work with, here they are:a) Screen fades without any particular reason, it may stay that way for a couple of minutes an then goes back to normal. it happens as much as 3 or 4 times per hour.b) The "click" function on the pad is unreliable, making me often move up to the buttons above.c) Screen locks on certain position and I must twist fold, turn, untwist, and finally. closing and opening does not fix the problem.d) windows pop up without even having the pointer near by.e) Battery does not hold even 2.5 hoursIt was a big disappointment, now I am trying the Surface Pro, and it's a much better machine.

The worst thing is window 8 which make the touchscreen useless, I have to work on traditional desktop in most of time.

Reviews.Title: Most bangs for the buck
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my Wife as a gift this is one of the best designed notebook of it's kind oft the moneyBusiness or just funLight weight and wonderful battery life

Reviews.Title: Excellent Design, but ...
Reviews.Author: J. Li
Reviews.Content: Really like the design, bought the twist on black Friday from staples.The laptop came with Windows 8, not Windows 8 pro. YES, some come with windows 8 pro, but many twists come with just windows 8. Reviews.Title: I got a lemon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Le user"
Reviews.Content: I’ve read a lot and picked this for many reasons: Price, look, weight.  I arrived 1 day earlier than expected and I couldn’t wait to open the box.My first impression was it is well built, beautiful looking and light enough for me to carry around.  After getting used to it, I discovered the first problem.  The screen goes dim intermittently for a few seconds then goes back to normal.  I adjust very thing but couldn’t get rid of it.  It drove me nut.  Then I discovered the second problem.  The screen does not always rotate when you turn the PC.  At times, it stays in portrait mode, refuses to turn no matter what you do.  I have to turn it off to resolve the problem.Other than that, the touch screen is responsive, the K/B is great.Over all, I think it’s a great product for the price but I just happen to get a lemon.  I could have it replaced but decided to return it after reading from other users stating they have similar problem.

Reviews.Title: Just a few minor cons
Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: Very fast.I get about 6 hours charge if the stretch is on (This can be found in Lenovo settings in metro mode under power, turn this on and then adjust to your liking.). 3.5 if surfing the web, still pretty good considering that was a drawback in a lot of other reviews I had read, but I got this Refurbished, if anything the glitches and errors were fixed? Regardless, I love the keyboard, the look isn't too bad either. It does get dirty quick, it is a touch screen after all. Lots of storage space, plus the 24 ssd.Some cons, the tablet mode is amazing, but just get rid of all the bloatware. Tweaks are needed to make this computer a little easier to use, I myself am still trying to figure out some things that bother me, like how to end programs in metro mode without having to go to task manager every time I want to close something. This however could be very simple and I just haven't figured it out yet, ha ha. The last drawback is the batter, it is internal, I am not sure if it's possible to remove, but I'm sure I will get a lot of time with this Thinkpad.Great overall!

Reviews.Title: Returned because of defect but I liked the laptop.
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: The quality of the twist part was better than expected.  Everything about the PC is of decent quality.  I would recommend if it fits your needs.  So many options out there.  The twist is perfect for some personal preferences.  Not to much here to disappoint.  I just got unlucky with a bad port.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for students, except the battery life
Reviews.Author: Maxine Roman
Reviews.Content: I bought the lenovo twist a few months ago an have been using it as my primary computer for school. I am a graduate student, so my primary usage for this laptop is checking email, taking notes in class, entering data and reading pdfs, so I'll be primarily addressing these uses.For taking notes, I downloaded a free windows 8 app called note anytime. I highly recommend it. Although it is fairly easy to write notes with your finger on the touchscreen, after a while it's just easier to use a pen. So I ended up getting a stylus and using this laptop in class to take written notes. The touchscreen is very responsive to writing with little to no delay. I have been taking notes in class with ease by just resting the laptop on my desk. I enjoy using a touchscreen laptop instead of a normal laptop or pen and paper because I am able to draw figures and diagrams with ease, while using the internet to look up information during lectures. Windows 8 has a feature that lets you swipe to switch between screens that is really helpful.For entering data on laptops, one of my pet peeves is that most normal sized laptops lack a number pad. One of the benefits of the lenovo twist is that it has a touchscreen keyboard that includes a number pad that I use quite often.For reading pdfs on the twist, it is very easy to use to annotate and read pdfs. My gripes are that the gorilla glass can have a lot of glare on it in the wrong lighting and that the twist is a bit heavy to hold like an ipad.Overall, I really enjoy using this laptop. The hardware of the twist is solid and any issues that I have had have been related to the learning curve of using Windows 8, except for the battery life. Lenovo advertises up to 7 hours of battery life on the laptop. So in my mind as a consumer, I am expecting to get around 5 hours. In actuality, I can get about 3-4h of usage with each charge. Considering this is supposed to be an ultrabook, this is disappointing. However, for my purposes, I don't use the computer unplugged for more than 2 hours at a time, so this has not hindered my experience. I hope in the future lenovo is able to solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet/laptop combo
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a "tablet" device that would not simply be a consumption device.  A device in other words that you could do actual work on.  I've had other tablets including a couple Ipads ,but it was difficult to do anything productive with these device.  I decided to take a chance with the Lenovo Twist and so far i've been pleasantly suprised.  I have only given it a 4 star rating becuase i have not had a chance to use it more extensively ,but i will say that its hard to go wrong with this "tablet"

Reviews.Title: Love the Twist
Reviews.Author: Thomas John Filley
Reviews.Content: Just got my Lenovo Twist. For the first time since 1995 I feel like I am working on something new and innovative. I love this machine. Windows 8 is still taking some getting used to.

Reviews.Title: Purchased Many for my Company. Terrible Choice
Reviews.Author: B. Windsor "-TaiDai"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased dozens of these for my company and they have been terribly unreliable. There are more hardware and firmware defects than you can shake a stick at. I've had to update firmware for the touchscreen so many times that I've considered having code written to automate the process. Even after updating the firmware some of them will still act funky. I've had numerous issues with the touchscreen freaking out as if it's being touched by several fingers having a seizure, there have been Sleep where as soon as the computer is unplugged it goes into Sleep mode no matter what the power settings are in Windows. Most recently, one of the touchscreens constantly scrolls right and makes any horizontally scrolling window almost unusable. In short, don't buy this product if you're looking for any sort of stability. It seems to be a crap shoot. None of this really surprises me either as all Lenovo products I've bought in the past 3 years have been crap.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo ThinkPad Twist is a junk computer
Reviews.Author: Kristy Bina
Reviews.Content: I got a think pad twist for Christmas and it crashed four days later. When I called Lenovo I had to argue with them for 6 hours before they would agree to take it back and fix it, despite having paid for a full warranty. They sent it back to me "fixed" only for it to crash again two months later. Again I sent it back to them. It is now on its forth crash in 15 months and they will not honor the warrenty. I would not recommend this computer or any Lenovo products to my worst enemy. They do not stand behind thier products at all!

Reviews.Title: Solid performer
Reviews.Author: kevin j gingrich md
Reviews.Content: solid machine, excellent keyboard, solidly built, my first Lenovo Thinkpad, will buy another, only complaint is battery life less thatn 4hours

Reviews.Title: This machine is poorly designed and unreliable.
Reviews.Author: LynneSnyder
Reviews.Content: I started a new job in January and they gave me the Lenovo S230u Twist. My new boss said it would be great for presentations and it's very flexible and that the company will be giving their sales people this product in the future. Do not buy this machine! Yes, it does rotate and you can make presentation with it but you can do the same thing with a normal laptop for less money!The keypad is the worst in the industry. It's upside down where the left and right buttons are near the keyboard not your thumbs. The corners of the mouse pad can be pressed but the pressure is inconsistent and the cursor is constantly moving around by itself.I own a Samsung Note 10.1 and it outperforms the twist hands down. The Note's screen is too small for more than one-on-one presentations however. But I have eliminated my paper notepad and do everything electronically.The Twist has a touch screen but doesn't offer a stylus for handwriting, something I love about the Note. All you end up doing is getting the screen dirty touching it. The screen resolution is poor as well. If the Twist did handwriting recognition I could live with the warts it has, but it doesn't.The Twists case has a matte black or grey finish and it sucks up finger oils and constantly looks dirty. Don't eat or snack while working because whatever you eat will end up on the case or mousepad. Bad design.The Twist can swivel. So what? Turn a normal less expensive laptop around and you can accomplish the same thing.The Twist crashes randomly. I don't know if it's because of Windows 8 or the unit itself but it's feels like the old school pc's that would just crash for no reason.The keyboard is weird as well. The delete key is above the backspace key. Not well thought out at all.This machine gets an "F-" for form, function, and price.Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Yujing
Reviews.Content: This laptop is good, although the rotation lock button did not work at the beginning, so I have to send it to Lenovo company  located in TN to repair it. But the service is very fast.

Reviews.Title: Really not Great
Reviews.Author: Chad Turner
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is really pretty bad, and the touch screen on this thing doesn't help much.  It goes unresponsive at times, and sometimes get confused as to which way the screen should be oriented.  I'd wait until the technology gets smoother.  Thought I had waited long enough myself, but no.

Reviews.Title: I don't know if I got a lemon or if it's just the way it is
Reviews.Author: C. Hughes
Reviews.Content: First thing: My laptop was left on the porch in freezing temperatures for hours. The delivery person did not even ring the doorbell.Issues: The screen frequently goes from light to dark. It seems like it's trying to adjust to the room's lighting but the lighting in the room doesn't change. It makes it very hard to read.The fan is extremely loud. I can't believe how loud it is. It doesn't come on often but when it does, watch out! It will take you by surprise.The touch screen is not very responsive. It works but I find it either being too sensitive or not sensitive enough. I know this may sound crazy but it is true. I don't use the touchscreen often. Perhaps, it's because of this.I'm doing basic internet browsing and the security software says that the browser is "high usage". It still works fine.Pros: I upgraded to Windows 8.1. There are a few bugs but the system runs really fast.I like the twist component. It makes it easier to share the screen. It seems pretty sturdy. I just have a feeling that one day, this thing is going to break.It is lighter than I expected. I thought it was going to be too heavy but it is surprisingly lightweight. It's not as light as a tablet, of course, but a lot lighter than my laptop. It's similar in weight to the Samsung Chromebook.I'm not sure if anything got damaged as a result of being in the cold. I gave it a week but I will contact Amazon if anything happens. I hope this review was helpful in some way.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo warranty - $950 to repair??? Are you kidding me?
Reviews.Author: lsouth
Reviews.Content: Purchase date May 1, 2013. Complete failure date December 19, 2013. Local IT resource looked at error code, said hard drive failure. Contacted Lenovo, returned the unit via their shipping/handling protocols. As I tracked the repair on their website, I saw they were waiting for customer authorization, although I had not been contacted.My surprise when I reached them? Not a repair under warranty as expected. They diagnosed a foreign substance spill, with total hard drive failure.Most surprising? They quoted $950 (yes, $950!) to repair a 7 1/2 month product that originally cost $740.What's wrong with this picture?  I asked to escalate the complaint, and am still waiting for a response.Not a happy camper. A big FAIL on customer service. Contrast this with a similar experience with a Dell Inspiron with next day, on site, zero cost to repair service.I truly regret this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, reliable and powerful. Touch screen isn't perfect, but a good laptop. Average/bulky tablet.
Reviews.Author: Pete Ash
Reviews.Content: Sleek, reliable and powerful. Touch screen isn't perfect, but a good laptop. Average/bulky tablet. No issues other than some tablet screen rotation features. Battery life is slightly below average.

Reviews.Title: Good quality Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: David Lemmo
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop after my previous laptop suffered yet another hard drive failure. This computer may seem small, but it is quite capable for most everything. I have been able on occasion been able to push the battery beyond the 5 hour life. I have seen little performance loss with battery saving power plan in use. Display is quite bright, and I have kept it on a dimmer setting to conserve battery, and to be easier on my eyes. The light weight and compact chassis of this laptop make it quite portable. Fast charging also makes this a very practical computer for its class.

Reviews.Title: good but could be better
Reviews.Author: WiseShopper
Reviews.Content: I have been using thinkpad laptops for the past 6 years and i love how they are reliable and well made. So when this came out, i got this for my girlfriend as a birthday gift. Overall the laptop is made very well and feels like a thinkpad. The touchpad however is a disspointment. According to her it does things by itself. Also the screen rotation sucks, it doesn't rotate properly when switching from tablet to laptop mode. Other than that, it works great. Batterylife is good and its very light. I wish it had a pressure sensative screen for pen like the other thinkpad tablets.

Reviews.Title: college
Reviews.Author: nomnom
Reviews.Content: Perfect for college.  I bought this to use for college and its just what I needed.  I think it would be better with more ram and the flip screen needs a little work but I cant complain overall since it works for what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Very good, very powerful computers.
Reviews.Author: taotao7616@yahoo.cn
Reviews.Content: Very good, very powerful computersVery good, very powerful computers.Boot reaction quickly.Let me fondle admiringly.This computer is good in general.Very good

Reviews.Title: not completely perfect
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: This laptop has a couple of problems with the auto rotate and touch screen not always being responsive, but otherwise I like it.

Reviews.Title: Thinkpad ultabook
Reviews.Author: Gregory T. Martens "Radishlady"
Reviews.Content: So I opened up my package, started up the laptop and set it up the way i wanted.I had to look at tutorials for win 8 since it's way different then win 7 and I'm used to win 7.Anyways Laptop works great for everything i need it for, like my schoolwork purposes and my artwork purposes.Some people said this laptop has a bad sound card or speakers. To me it sounds fine, it's louder then my old laptop. So i'm not sure why they said that.Some people have also said the screen dims out once and while. Which it does but it's not so bad of an issue.The only thing i have an issue with is how overly sensitive it is with touch, which is irritating, I'm not sure if it's just a thinkpad thing or just a general touchscreen laptop thing. Because i never had a laptop like this one.The only thing I wish it did have was a tablet pen or was able to use tablet pens on the screen.I may update it later if i see other issues.

Reviews.Title: Great, if you are willing to spend some time
Reviews.Author: Miguel Santiago
Reviews.Content: Look at the tips in the previous comments. They are a must to get it running well.Remove the bloat ware, update all drivers and update the Lenovo programs. Be willing to live with the quirk of having to access the Realtek HD Manager advanced setting in the control panel, every time you connect headphones. Aside from that its a lot of machine for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Not a good tablet or computer
Reviews.Author: Julio Interiano
Reviews.Content: this computer is trying to do to much without adequate software.  The screen lock and unlock button does not work that way its supposed to.  You have to move it to a tablet mode to rotate the screen.  Its just not a good product to buy yet.  You're better off buying a normal laptop and a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Had it for 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Elijah wood
Reviews.Content: I have has this laptop for two weeks and already the auto rotate is broken. And now when I try to start it up it will only show the lenovo sign. This computer is very frustrating and annoying.

Reviews.Title: Awesome device for the price
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase this through Amazon but from another vendor that offered an incentive that i could not pass up.  I will start with my initial changes so everyone knows how i am configured for this review.Replaced the 24gb mSATA card with a 128gb mSATA card.Clean install of windows 8 on the 128gb mSATA card and relocated my document libruary's to the 500gb drive.Boot up and shut down are between 3 to 5 seconds.I just it primarly as a mobile media device, movies, itunes email, full office 2013 just for giggles.  I also have cyberlink DVD ultra 13 and XBMC 12.2 installed and have over 300gb of movies.This ultrabook screams with this configuration.  movies play back flawlessly, yes the screen is not HD but i was looking for a very small light weight untrabook, the tablet function was a bonus.  everything works perfectly, touchpad, touch screen, tablet mode (does not use a pen like others do) I did pull down all of the updated drivers from lenovo which included some firmware updates for the touchscreen.  plus there is a button on the side of the touchscreen that will lock the position in place just above the power button. I get about 3 to 4 hours of battery life but could be better if i turned down the screen brightness but i leave it set to auto.  if i am not watching my movies on the screen i use a mini-hdmi to hdmi cable and send the full 1080p image to that.  one of the updates from the lenovo site includes the display .ini file for the majority of TV's out on the market so when i connected the twist to my Vizio TV it detected the model perfectly and alloed me to set the video display to 1080p.  you cant run a cloned screen to do this,  you have to change your video output to digital TV to make this change and when you do your laptop screen will go black.  but you can control everything using your TV as the monitor.for the Money, i would buy it again (and i HATE anyting related to IBM) but this is a really good device for what i am using it for.One more thing,  a lot of people complain about the touchpad buttons being on top.  at least with the updated drivers i use the lower left and right hand corners of the touchbad to access the same functions at the upper buttons.Great Device!!

Reviews.Title: Levovo ThinkPad Twist S230u 12.5-Inch Touchscreen Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: Doris Scott
Reviews.Content: The battery lasts surprising longer than any other laptop I have had previously.I especially like typing on the keyboard because you can really get a "feel" for the keys.It is portable, powerful and light.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Irma Galvez
Reviews.Content: the computer is great, super fast, it turns on in just a few seconds, I love it specially the rotation of the screen has come very handy

Reviews.Title: Good except for display resolution
Reviews.Author: newday
Reviews.Content: I like this laptop and it is of thinkpad quality as expected. However in the period of retina display this one is of very low resolution!Not sure, why lenova thinks this resolution is ok for 12.5 inch display when people are expecting retina display for ipad mini.Rest every thing is good with the laptop, really liked it but i have to live with such a low resolution display.

Reviews.Title: Is it a laptop, a tablet, or a dream come true?  YES
Reviews.Author: Bruce L Lininger
Reviews.Content: Twice the machine for half the price of anything MAC!  Love the Windows 8 environment and the options to use it as a tablet and business partner.

Reviews.Title: image rotation and screen clarity problem.
Reviews.Author: Harendra Shah
Reviews.Content: 1. Image rotation is not functioning well.2.screen clarity goes down for some and returns on its own which is disturbing

Reviews.Title: Driving me nuts!
Reviews.Author: garfodie81
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if it's the computer's issue or a Windows 8 thing, but my computer is driving me nuts! Nearly every time I resume from sleep mode, the screen rotates some other direction. Even though auto-rotate is disabled. And sometimes I get the bonus of the narrator coming on for no reason, randomly, even though that is disabled as well.Otherwise, this computer has served me well. Small and lightweight. Easy to bring into the kitchen in the flat mode for reading recipes, or Netflix on tent mode while washing dishes. I find I don't really use it's "twist" features often enough, though, to warrant the price.

Reviews.Title: Great computer but slow to link to wifi
Reviews.Author: Reviewer R
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little computer.Can do touch screen as a tablet or as a laptop.Pretty light.However, it's a slow to wake up and takes an insanely long time to latch on to Wifi

Reviews.Title: pretty cool
Reviews.Author: jon
Reviews.Content: great in every way but for some weird reason the touchscreen sometimes doesn't work. dropped it a few times and it had no scratches and worked perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: Still growing on me
Reviews.Author: J. Evans
Reviews.Content: The twist feature is a bit of a gimmick, and I'm not sure I'll ever really use it that much, so I kind of wish I just had a regular thinkpad.  I turned off some of the display features so it wouldn't auto-dim anymore.However, this is a nice, solid ultrabook with a great feel and nice finish.  I like the keyboard and the touchscreen a lot.  Great for the price.  I'd like to put an SSD in it to give it a bit of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Love the touch screen
Reviews.Author: Gary W. Lepak
Reviews.Content: I've had this about 3 weeks now.  I don't have a tablet and thought that perhaps this would kill two birds.  It is not as light as a tablet but it is still not too bad on my lap or on a table.  I have been getting used to the touch screen having only owned one on my smartphone before.  I use it mostly in the laptop mode for email as I like to write on the keyboard since I touch type.  I don't find it a problem to reach the 3" from the keyboard or mouse pad to the screen,  which has become my habit for scrolling pages or using swipe gestures.When I first got the Twist I went to the Lenovo site and updated everything so I haven't had any issues some reviewers have mentioned. It took me awhile to get used to Win8 but I am liking it more and more.  It is a good match to a touch screen.I once had an IBM laptop, 13-14 years ago, with the red mouse button thingy in the middle of the keyboard.  But since then have used just touch pads and mice.  I've tried using it again but find it hard to control the cursor speed and direction so revert to the mouse or touch pad.  Or just use my finger on the screen.  So I think I could do without that feature, but it doesn't hurt to have it there.  There are so many ways to interact with this computer that I see new habits forming.I have one complaint/frustration with this laptop so far, which I hope to resolve in the future. Although the screen scrolling and swiping seems flawless, I have had trouble with tapping, often needing to tap an icon 3 or 4 times to get an action.  The manual says to calibrate the screen frequently but I could not find directions for how to do it.  I went online and downloaded a calibration tool for Lenovo even though it said it was for Win7. (Couldn't find one for Win8) When I went to install it a pop up said I already had it on my computer so I did not install and override what I supposedly had.  Well, I have not been able to locate it on my computer.  But right after downloading it,  it popped up on the screen and when I touched the red button in the center it said, "No device found", with no directions about what to do about it.  I haven't seen it since.  Since then I have not put any effort into pursuing this and often find I use the mouse and keyboard buttons for clicking.  It does seem like it is getting better though, which may just be my technique improving.  Some time in the future I will work on figuring out screen calibration again as it is somewhat frustrating to have to go back and forth from the screen to buttons or touch pad, and I cannot do that when it is in tablet mode..One other tiny quibble:  I bought a mini hdmi to regular hdmi adapter, which works fine.  I always hook up to a 32" monitor when I am at home.  But the usb port next to it is so close  that the swelled shape of the adapter pushes against my usb tethering hookup and I have my wireless mouse in the other usb port.  Hopefully the pressure between them won't damage anything.  So next time I would get an hdmi adapter with a little wire on it.  Some usb plugs would probably not fit next to it at all.

Reviews.Title: I had such high hopes but this machine is awful
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I bought this at a big box store with high hopes. I wanted to like it but here's why I ultimately returned it.1. Battery Life is unacceptable 3+ hours doesn't cut it today in a "tablet"2. trackpad is awful, flickers and constantly toggles screen mode because of some mystery "gesture" i must be doing.3. RAM is permanently installed and therefore, what you get is all you'll ever have. This is not evident anywhere before purchase and I find it misleading.4. If this machine is being hyped as a tablet then put one large SSD in the thing. This 500GB hard drive and 24GB SSD is a completely inefficient setup and contributes to awful battery life5. buggy buggy buggy! Everything about this machine has some level of frustration (I'm not gigging the machine because I'm not a fan of windows 8, but windows 8 is not an OS I like)6. Thick and heavy- everyone else has screens half this thickness, what's with lenovo? And the actual computer part, there's no disc drive in it, why on earth is this thing so thick?Overall, I basically hate everything about this machine and therefore back it went. Maybe you'll have a different experience but I think this computer is absolutely rotten.

Reviews.Title: Highly defective model.
Reviews.Author: Laolu Yemitan
Reviews.Content: The product has been an abysmal failure. Too many glitches from the screen orientation, browser, hardware, power management (not close to the 7 hours they suggested), and so much more. This product had been discontinued by Microsoft's retail offices in Houston, which should have been a RED flag to me, but I went ahead and purchased it nonetheless. I have owned the product less than two months, and the issues I've encountered have been unbelievable. It seems these series have an inherent disfunctionality, however, Lenovo has made no recalls. I'm curious to know how there are some people having success with their models, as my experience has been horrendous.

Reviews.Title: Please avoid my mistake
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: I would give a more detailed review, but other users have already described everything that is wrong with this laptop. The power button is functional when it would like to be, the computer becomes slow and intermittently unresponsive over the course of only a few months, the auto-rotate screen function is also impossible to toggle with. I have also almost thrown this laptop against a wall, like a previous reviewer described. The battery life is nowhere near 5 hours, and is more along the lines of 30 minutes - 1 hour. Windows 8 is installed on it, and is a headache in and of itself. Please, go for a mac. Customer support is better, and though it's pricier, it is worth paying to avoid the hours upon hours of frustration this laptop will cause you.

Reviews.Title: Meets my needs
Reviews.Author: Farouk
Reviews.Content: Update day 18Many of the issues with this computer can be cured with software update. However short battery life is a deal breaker for many. Although I have not done a detailed test I would estimate that by using the computer to its full potential with 100% screen brightness the battery life would be about 2 hours. By using all the battery saving features the battery life can be extended to about 4 hours.  I have purchased Anker® Astro Pro2 20000mAh Ultra-High Capacity external battery from Amazon for 99 dollars and it gives almost 2 full charges to the battery.  I am happy with my purchase.20000mAh Ultra High Multi Voltage Notebooks Compatible==============================================Update -  day 10Disable autorotate in device driver. Very simple solution.  There is a registry update - dowloadable from lenovo which cures the sudden dimming.  The hardware is fine except for short battery life. Most isssues are solvable with software update or better still a fresh installation with Windows professional 64 bit cd.  It will activate automatically.  I am looking to purchase and external battery pack. This computer is perfect for a large e reader on a long flight.==============================Update - Day 7I have found a registry hack file that will lock autorotation.It does the tick![...]OPTION 4=============================================I have had it for 5 days and have this happy feeling that I have finally found a convertible laptop that meets my need.  I use a separate desktop for most of my computing.  I need a laptop on vacations. I also need a LARGE e book reader and a tablet when watching TV with my wife. Lenovo twist does the trick for me.The 2 issues that bothered me most were1)Autorotation2)Sudden dimming1) Autorotation . I wanted to turn it off completely and let the screen remain inlandscape mode.I found a registry hack here[...]2}Dimming.  There is a setting under display with default at 50%. just change it to 100%

Reviews.Title: various flaws, ended up returning
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: This laptop has multiple flaws. Some of these problems are:-brightness keeps changing-screen always rotates, even when I don't move it, and won't rotate back-apps will randomly close or not load-mouse doesn't work-charger doesn't work (BIG problem, ended up returning it because of this)-battery only lasts for two hours tops with moderate use-clicker on mouse doesn't work-keyboard sometimes doesn't work-laptop will shut down randomly-screen often freezesBecause of these flaws and some others, I ended up returning this laptop. There are good qualities of it and it is very easy to use, but in general, I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love this product!  Touchscreen!
Reviews.Author: Solana Maria Bottem
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop and since I am notoriously hard on technology I did not want to spend too much as I "self-insure" when I need a new one.  I am still amazed that this laptop has so much functionality for the price.Windows 8 has been a definite learning curve however it works so well with the touchscreen capabilities.The other reviews adequately to the technical features so I will not comment on these and full disclosure my good friends in the IT department at my former company did all the set up for me.This laptop has been amazing for my needs and frankly I am still shocked at the price.  I use mostly for internet surfing, some document work, Pinterest, Facebook, and similar programs.  The touchscreen makes it so much easier to use in all these functions because you can navigate like my beloved iPhone with touch but then flip right to typing with the keyboard.  Win!Very happy that I bought this although I do not use in the "pad" configuration as much as I expected when I purchased.

Reviews.Title: thats ok
Reviews.Author: mauricio villalobos
Reviews.Content: has a very fast processor and good but when you convert it to the graphics tablet does not rotate fast enough and has some problems with the touch screenbut generally works fine

Reviews.Author: Tableter
Reviews.Content: I would say that this machine is for those who are looking for a high performance LAPTOP not convertible tablet. There's not an option for a stylus that works therefore completely useless for those people who want a fully functional convertible. My dad brought this machine home from work and I was very excited to play with it the only problem came when I tried to write with a compacitive stylus ( Steve jobs creation) it was PITIFUL. though the twist is a great over all laptop it is not for the die hard student or meeting gower that wants to take note or any kind of art on their machine. This is a great laptop not tablet. For a full review with specs and soon to be videos go to the website in the title!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Idea but does not function
Reviews.Author: Nick Bellucci
Reviews.Content: The concept of combining a traditional PC and tablet is a great idea and one I was waiting for.  However, after receiving this product and using it for less than 2 days we noticed a major flaw with the product.  When transitioning from tablet back to PC mode the screen does not automatically correct itself and on many occassions will be locked in the sideview or upside down view.  We called Lenovo who stated that this is a known problem and even replacing the screen would not correct the issue.  We returned it to get our money back.

Reviews.Author: penname

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Faith Believer "faithwalker"
Reviews.Content: Lenovo evidently do not care about customer service, it appears they only care about the sales. I have had a horrible experience dealing with Lenovo's customer service. I dealt with two weeks of wasted time and patience. These are the events with Lenovo that took place over a two week period:I went to the Lenovo website to order and customize a Think-pad X230t convertible, but as I proceeded to customize the item in my cart it was showing as a Think-pad 230. It took talking to four customer reps in India (after 6pm) to try to get an answer as to whether my order in my cart was matching what I wanted. For whatever reason I could not get a definite answer, I then decided to call during normal business hours. Spoke with a rep to get an answer and still could not get a definitive answer.Called the next day and spoke with another rep, got a definitive answer from her, she informed me "yes she can order and customize a Think-pad X230T convertible for me." We proceeded to customize my order. Finally I was going to get the product I wanted, and it was not cheap, especially with the customization. She then told me that she would send me a quote to verify the order before it was processed. I received an email later on that afternoon of the supposed quote and it was a cut and paste of their website, unbelievable!!! I called Lenovo once again, spoke with a rep about the "supposed quote," he informed me that he would contact the sales team to inform them of the error and someone should be calling me later on that day. Needless to say, I did not receive the phone call.Two days later I received an email that my order was being shipped. I then called back to cancel the order and a rep told me it was too late to cancel the order. I would have to receive the item and then call back for a return label. I called the following day and asked to speak to a supervisor. They put me on hold for 15 minutes, after fifteen minutes I hung up. I then redialed and again asked to speak to a supervisor, again I was put on hold for another 20 minutes (they were probably hoping I would get tired of waiting and hung up). When they figured out I was not going to hang up, they hung up on me. I then found a Think-pad S230U at my local Micro-Center. I really wanted try this product out. Once I got it home, unpacked the box, charged the battery, it showed 2hrs of battery time. It stated in the specs that it was an 8 cell lithium battery. There is no way that this battery should be showing 2hours. I spoke with a representative at Micro-Center to let them know I needed an exchange. He informed me that they were out of stock and they will be receiving their next shipment maybe sometime next week. I decided to call their corporate headquarters; well the number bounced me back to the recorded sales robot. I am sending both of these convertible laptops back and Lenovo will not ever have to worry about me spending my money or time with them ever again.

Reviews.Title: Half way there
Reviews.Author: A. Jones "arj"
Reviews.Content: I have had this laptop for almost a year now. I needed a touch screen laptop and this one had a great price. I liked the fact that I could use it as a tablet.Here is what I like.1) It's very lightweight and portable.2) As a photographer, I love the fact that the screen adjusts to the light.3) With the exceptions below, this laptop functions very well. I am able to do all of my work, as long as the screen doesn't decide to rotate on it's own or some swipe gesture is triggered while I am trying to work.4) It's pretty sturdy. I've lugged it around all over the place and even dropped it a couple of times.Here is what I don't like.1) It gets hot. This makes the tablet function, for me, fairly useless. You would not want to hold this on your lap for very long.2) The gestures on the touch pad. This was a huge, gigantic pain in the ass to get rid of. Today, I can't even tell you how I did it. I had to remove the driver and re-install it and spent hours fixing the settings. I did not need these gestures. I have a touch screen. If I want gestures, I'll touch my screen. Trying to use the touch pad to move the mouse cursor around was difficult because gestures would constantly be triggered. I prefer this to using the little red mouse button. This is a preference that should be accounted for int he touch pad settings.3)I'm not sure if this is Windows 8 or my computer, but my internet connection gets dropped a lot, requiring me to reboot my laptop. I know that the issue is with the laptop and not the wireless router because everyone around me is onlne when this happens.4) I can't swipe the screen and get the charms bar. I haven't seen it for months. I started researching a solution for this and gave up after a while.5) Auto Rotate triggers by itself for reasons that I haven't quite figured out. For a while, I was having issues not being able to get out of the rotated screen. A driver update helped with that.I probably would not buy this laptop again.

I bit more expensive, but the screen and stylus interaction are awesome allowing our service managers to fill out forms in the field.I get the feeling the S230 is more of a consumer\casual user machine, while the x230 feels heavier duty and more appropriate for business use.

Reviews.Title: This is a S***-TASTIC model
Reviews.Author: Theebs
Reviews.Content: I am not the type of person who writes reviews in leisure nor do I exaggerate when it comes to being a critic. When I say that this laptop is the worst thing you can probably buy with your money, go on a hunt for something better.I am a college student who is aiming for education beyond college. So when I as browsing through laptops, I looked for portability, sturdiness, endurance, fast processes, and of course affordability. Most important feature I was looking into was endurance since I may have to use the newly purchased laptop beyond college and into the workforce.This laptop is no mean cheap; this is reasonably priced I would say because this is very sturdy which maintains the integrity of Lenovo. However, what really struck me to buy this item is the hybrid functionality of switching between a laptop and a tablet. I've heard many good things about Lenovo so I went ahead to purchase this product. Now, I will never purchase any Lenovo Ultrabook EVER again.This is my second Lenovo product that I've purchased and the first was Lenovo Yoga 13. I liked the model a lot, I'm not gonna lie. The model was thin, light, fast, but a bit expensive. Within a few weeks I returned it because of mousepad problems. The right click didn't work in some websites which I didn't understand. Also, the memory was WAY TOO SMALL for a student who's always typing and making documents for school. So unfortunately, that was out.A few weeks later, I found Lenovo twist. I thought this laptop was perfect because it's under 4 pounds, compact, touchscreen (which I really grew into liking) and twice the memory of those of Yoga, being that it is still an Ultrabook. If I can rewind back in time, I would have never purchased this product.The first problem with this laptop is the POWER BUTTON.It's a very tiny button on the lower right side of the screen right below the lock button, which is used during tablet mode. You have to press this button VERY HARD or MANY TIMES or else, it won't turn on. Sometimes, it doesn't respond to the button so much that I pressed this for a good 30 sec and it just turned on and off by itself. WTF lenovo.The second problem is the SCREEN.There's nothing wrong with the touchscreen. Actually, it's very responsive and it feels just like a touchphone. It's not as smooth as an iPad but, not bad.The problem with the screen is the FLIPLOCK. This model is a hybrid of tablet and laptop. So when you twist the screen, it automatically read which side is upright and it changes the configuration. It doesn't understand when I'm using it as a laptop or a tablet. However, the quick fix for this is the LOCK button above the POWER button. And guess what? It doesn't read my inputs correctly either! So I'm stuck with a tablet screen whilst in a laptop mode!! I understand there's a quick fix for this but I don't want a quick fix! I want my laptop to be normally fucntional! It's freaking new, so why is it acting like I used this for years??the third and the BIGGEST turnoff for this model is the MOUSEPADOMG it is SO POORLY made. The mousepad feels really, really course and thick. So naturally, I thought it won't read your inputs easily. I was wrong.This mousepad is so HYPERSENSITIVE that it doesn't understand a light touch from a tap. It highlights EVERYTHING that I'm trying to read and in one instance deleted my texts. Do you know how much I suffered from this mousepad?And please, don't tell me 'you can uninstall the driver and download the older version' or 'change the settings of your mouse' or 'update the mousepad driver' or even 'download a separate mouse program' because I've done ALL of that and NOTHING seems to work. Now I have to opt out to use the nipple and even THAT doesn't understand my movements. This is a HARDWARE problem. Not the software. Sometimes, it reads the pressure of my wrist resting on the side of the laptop as a click. So it's not software, it's an internal malfunction. Lenovo, fix your damn mousepads. It's terrible. Get it right or you're gonna lose customers.Fourth problem is with WifiTo be really honest, the wifi connection is bad in ways that it keeps getting disconnected but since I'm so distracted by other horrific features, this is in the shadows of flaws in this model. Good thinking Lenovo!Keep in mind, this was not manufacturer refurbished, used, or damaged. This was absolutely new and I was the first person to use the computer. If I could I would SO return this in a heartbeat but since Lenovo's warranty sucks (I would have to mail this to TX to fix in weeks!) and I don't have money to buy another model, I's stuck with this piece of crap. My Squaretrade warranty wouldn't help me and I can't even return this through Amazon because if I send this laptop over, what am I gonna use in school?!?! This was my first time trying out Lenovo because I've heard SO many great things about this brand and how it keeps its integrity in each model.I agree that it keeps its integrity as in if I drop this laptop it would not break. But the normal functionality just SUCKS.So thanks for ripping off a college student Lenovo. I hope you're happy. And I will NEVER purchase your products EVER again.
